comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
I'm running the crruent WTP 2.0 from the update site in eclipse 3.3

1. Setup a glassfish V2 server
2. Create an EAR with a bunch of projects in it
3. Create a GWT project using the eclipseguru GWT plugin and add it to the EAR
4. Action X which causes this, one of:
   GWT development
   Changing the database schema
5. Publish to the glassfish server

See this in the logs:

Error: Could not publish to the server.

eclipse.buildId=I20070608-1718
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.ModulePackager.pack(ModulePackager.java:179)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.EarModuleAssembler.packModule(EarModuleAssembler.java:75)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.EarModuleAssembler.assemble(EarModuleAssembler.java:49)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.assembleModule(AntPublisher.java:121)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.publishers.AntPublisher.publish(AntPublisher.java:108)
at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core.internal.GenericServerBehaviour.publishModule(GenericServerBehaviour.java:84)
at com.sun.enterprise.jst.server.sunappsrv.SunAppServerBehaviour.publishModule(SunAppServerBehaviour.java:95)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModule(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:749)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModules(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:835)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publish(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:669)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:887)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:874)
at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:72)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)


It would appear that there is some kind of empty or non-existant folder that it's trying to add to the pack, but I don't know which one, and I don't know how to find out which one.

Ideally there'd be a null check inserted into this code which handles the problem gracefully (or at least logs some useful debugging information).


More information:

Deleting all the metadata for one of the projects (my current cure-all for webtools problems) resolves the problem; whatever it is, it's something happening in webtools' own files, caching, or something.

I have added that null check but It would great if I get to the bottom of it and find the reason for the missing directories. Is there anything running in your environment that may remove a directory?

Hi, I often remove directories manually, or rename directories.  I think somehow the metadata wasn't in sync with what was on disk, but I can't prove anything.  I haven't had a recurrence of this bug.
I see, I have released the null check. Resolving
